paragraphs.text: If you don’t believe misery it’s a choice, your have already forfeited your power to someone or something outside of yourself, and thus are enslaved to that thing.
paragraphs.name: 1b95

paragraphs.text: Your inner-state and outer-state are mirrors, reflecting back and forth at each other. When you see one, you also see the other. As James Allen said in As a Man Thinketh, “Circumstances do not make the man, they reveal him.”
paragraphs.name: 64c4

paragraphs.text: If you keep showing up, you can’t help but succeed. Why? Because it’s rare. Most people are in a state of consumption, not creation. Most people are in a state of skepticism and scarcity, not gratitude and abundance. Most people are in a state of passivity, not activity.
paragraphs.name: 63a8

paragraphs.text: Doing what you know, however, is rare. And that, right there, is the dividing line between happiness and misery, failure and success. Living what you know. As Woody Allen explained, “Eighty percent of success is showing up.”

paragraphs.name: dd62
paragraphs.text: It is a choice.
Knowing what you should do isn’t going to improve your life. As Tony Robbins has said, “Knowledge is not power. Knowledge is only potential power. Action is power.”

Knowing what to do is easy. Doing what you know, however, is rare. And that, right there, is the dividing line between happiness and misery, failure and success. As Woody Allen explained, “Eighty percent of success is showing up.”

Knowing what to do is easy. Doing what you know, however, is rare. And that, right there, is the dividing line between happiness and misery, failure and success. As Woody Allen explained, “Eighty percent of success is showing up.”

paragraphs.name: 63a8
paragraphs.text: If you keep showing up, you can’t help but succeed. Why? Because it’s rare. Most people are in a state of consumption, not creation. Most people are in a state of skepticism and scarcity, not gratitude and abundance. Most people are in a state of passivity, not activity.

Knowing what to do is easy. Doing what you know, however, is rare. And that, right there, is the dividing line between happiness and misery, failure and success. As Woody Allen explained, “Eighty percent of success is showing up.”

Your inner-state and outer-state are mirrors, reflecting back and forth at each other. When you see one, you also see the other. As James Allen said in As a Man Thinketh, “Circumstances do not make the man, they reveal him.”
paragraphs.name: 64c4

paragraphs.text: The science is quite clear on “confidence” — it’s the product of previous performance. If, then, you have a good morning, your chances of having a good afternoon are almost guaranteed. If you have a good day, your chances of having a good week are high.
A small spark will ignite within you.
paragraphs.name: 6df1

paragraphs.text: For example, if you believe you should get up in the morning and exercise. Do it.

paragraphs.text: As my friend Kimberly Wiefling says, “There is a knowing-doing gap. Knowing isn’t enough.” Thanks for reminding us, Benjamin, to “show up.”

3f7547f314a2.title: I realized, a few days ago, that I had lived the negative cycle for decades.

paragraphs.text: I realized, a few days ago, that I had lived the negative cycle for decades. Once I was able to get out of it and switch to the positive one, my life changed entirely. Within 3–4 years I’ve built, got and conquered all I couldn’t even imagine before.
paragraphs.name: 3c78

1c6043912f90.title: One of my favorite quotes. Spot on.

paragraphs.text: One of my favorite quotes. Spot on.

7859602d074d.title: The secret to success is to do what you must do when you must do it.

paragraphs.text: The secret to success is to do what you must do when you must do it. Easier said than done of course.
Responsibility.
paragraphs.name: 7ed2

paragraphs.text: This is extremely true.
paragraphs.name: c277

b5e4beb4cf33.title: Benjamin, your writings are always on-time with what is going on in my life.

paragraphs.text:
Benjamin, your writings are always on-time with what is going on in my life. It’s like you write for me alone :) 
Taking action is what I am doing now. I left my “paying the bills” job, to focus on my coaching full time. 
I know it will improve not only my life, but the lives of many others. It would be wrong for me not to do it. 
Many thanks, as…

75b58d2fcc77.title: The concept of it being a choice is a game changer.

paragraphs.text: The concept of it being a choice is a game changer. It empowers you. It only took me about 35 years to learn and I have to constantly remind myself that I always have a choice!
paragraphs.name: 8c10

3d9e42e1180c.title: One of the keys for me with any task that requires an extra level of self-motivation (exercise…

paragraphs.text: One of the keys for me with any task that requires an extra level of self-motivation (exercise, writing, etc), is making the decision ahead of time.
Committing to myself that I’m going to exercise tomorrow morning, or I’m going to write the outline for a new article on Saturday.

virtuals.subtitle: Committing to myself that I’m going to exercise tomorrow morning, or I’m going to write the outline for a new article on Saturday.

content.subtitle: Committing to myself that I’m going to exercise tomorrow morning, or I’m going to write the outline for a new article on Saturday.

paragraphs.text: Great articlebBenjamin P. Hardy .I think the main reason why people don’t do in spite of knowing what to do is the fear of failure followed by the fear of ridicule.

paragraphs.text: The first thought that comes is What will happen if I fail ?

paragraphs.text: You framed this so well. It’s kind of like that old commercial where the person hits himself/herself in the head and says, “I could have had a V8.” It’s one of those “duh” moments, and yet how many times do we make the choice not to do what common sense is begging of us?
paragraphs.name: c1f2

paragraphs.text: Beautiful :)
paragraphs.name: 89ee

332d269bf430.title: Benjamin, you are “right on” about knowledge and action.

paragraphs.text: Benjamin, you are “right on” about knowledge and action. My saying has been, “Knowing what you know is knowledge. Act on it and that is called wisdom…and wisdom can not be denied.” It works for me all day, every day.
paragraphs.name: afe8

paragraphs.text: Fully agree. Found myself spiraling too much on theory. Since I started reading your posts its been a shift from theory to practice. Great inspiration!
